title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: bottom table hierarchy, list substances. substance, primary key pk, chemical name based IUPAC nomenclature, substance names three four official languages Switzerland. first four entries 453 shown .
code: library(knitr) example_register$substances |>    select(pk, iupac, substance_de, substance_fr, substance_it) |>    head(n = 4L) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: three tables defining products, pNbrs, products ingredients. P-Numbers contained table pNbrs identifiers product compositions. Products P-Number considered equivalent terms efficacy risks. table pNbrs technical reason. simply contains column holding P-Numbers.

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: composition products terms active substances, additives declare, synergists safeners defined table ingredients, giving contents percent weight per weight (percent). liquid products, content grams per litre also given (g_per_L). substance contained form differs definition given substance table, documented respective additional columns illustrated first five rows shown . frequency occurrence four different ingredient types quite different. Additives declare additives effect classification labelling product. substances occurring synergists safeners listed . Note first two lines code also replaced makes use foreign key declaration data object. However, explicit version using left_join probably easier understand.
code: example_register$ingredients |>    select(pNbr, pk, type, percent, g_per_L, ingredient_de, ingredient_fr) |>    head(n = 5L) |>    kable() library(dplyr) example_register$ingredients |>    select(pk, type) |>    unique() |>    group_by(type) |>    summarize(n = n()) |>    kable() example_register$ingredients |>    left_join(example_register$substances, by = "pk") |>   filter(type %in% c("SYNERGIST", "SAFENER")) |>   group_by(type, substance_de) |>    summarize(n = n(), .groups = "drop_last") |>    select(type, substance_de, n) |>    arrange(type, substance_de) |>    kable() example_register |>    dm_flatten_to_tbl(ingredients) |>

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: registered products identified -called W-Numbers. relation P-Numbers W-Numbers illustrated showing first five entries products table. can seen example entries, several registrations (W-Numbers) product type (P-Number) can exist. W-Numbers without dash (e.g. 18) original registrations, ones containing dash trailing number (e.g. 18-1, 18-2) equivalent products sales permissions different legal entity permission holder. product registration revoked, relevant latest dates selling product (soldoutDeadline) use product (exhaustionDeadline) given respective columns. build time vignette, 1739 product registrations 1139 P-Numbers Swiss Register Plant Protection Products (SRPPP) published website Federal Food Safety Veterinary Office.
code: example_register$products |>    select(-terminationReason) |>    head() |>    kable() example_register$products |>   filter(exhaustionDeadline != "") |>    select(-terminationReason) |>    head() |>    kable()

what: Example code for getting a product composition from a product name
title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: name product known, associated P-Numbers W-Numbers well product composition can retrieved command like following.
code: example_register$products |>   filter(name == "Plüsstar") |>   left_join(example_register$ingredients, by = "pNbr") |>   left_join(example_register$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(pNbr, name, substance_de, percent, g_per_L) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: product type (P-Number), registered uses (tagged <Indication> XML file) specified uses table. use numbers column use_nr generated reading XML file, order able refer use combination P-Number (pNbr) use number (use_nr). columns min_dosage max_dosage contain either range recommended product concentrations spraying solution percent, , min_dosage given, recommended concentration. Similarly, single recommended application rate, stored min_rate. recommended range application rates, max_rate given well. units application rate given columns starting units_. addition, required waiting period harvest can specified, well application area associated use.
code: example_register$uses |>    filter(pNbr %in% c(6521L, 7511L) & use_nr < 10) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, ends_with("dosage"), ends_with("rate"), units_de,     waiting_period, time_units_en, application_area_de) |>    head(20) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: Application rates terms grams active substances contained products per hectare can calculated using function application_rate_g_per_ha() illustrated example . first step, uses need selected joined information ingredients table. names active substances can joined well. , application rates can calculated uses illustrated .
code: example_uses <- example_register$products |>    filter(wNbr == "6168") |>   left_join(example_register$uses, by = join_by(pNbr),     relationship = "many-to-many") |>    left_join(example_register$ingredients, by = join_by(pNbr),     relationship = "many-to-many") |>   left_join(example_register$substances, by = join_by(pk)) |>   select(pNbr, name, use_nr,     min_dosage, max_dosage, min_rate, max_rate, units_de,     application_area_de,     substance_de, percent, g_per_L) |>    filter(use_nr %in% c(1:5, 12:17))  kable(example_uses) application_rate_g_per_ha(example_uses) |>   select(ai = substance_de, app_area = application_area_de,   ends_with("rate"), units_de, rate = rate_g_per_ha) |>    head(n = 14) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: current SRPPP versions, two culture forms, greenhouse cultivation field cultivation. specific uses, e.g. uses number 1 10 product “Kumulus WG” W-Number 4458, associated culture form registered cultures can listed shown . use typically associated one culture form, culture form actual cultures can joined use numbers one step. Relations cultures stored [data.tree::Node] object attribute named ‘culture_tree’. first entries tree shown . complete culture tree shown Appendix. Note culture can linked two parent cultures tree. Cultures additionally present another position tree marked appending ‘[dup]’ name.
code: example_register$culture_forms |>    select(starts_with("culture")) |>    unique() |>    kable() example_register$products |>    filter(wNbr == "4458") |>    left_join(example_register$uses, by = "pNbr") |>    filter(use_nr %in% c(1, 10)) |>    left_join(example_register$culture_forms, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    left_join(example_register$cultures, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, application_area_de, culture_form_de, culture_de) |>    kable() culture_tree <- attr(example_register, "culture_tree") print(culture_tree, limit = 30, "culture_id") ##                                               levelName culture_id ## 1  Cultures                                                        ## 2   ¦--allg. title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: target organisms use can found table pests. Example code retrieving target organisms specific uses given .
code: example_register$pests |>    filter(pNbr == 7105L, use_nr %in% 1:2) |>    select(use_nr, ends_with("de"), ends_with("fr")) |>    kable()

what: Unique combinations of cultures and target organisms
title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: calculations mean application rates Swiss National Risk Indicator (Korkaric et al. 2022, 2023), unique combinations product, culture, target organism termed “indications”. Note using definition indications, XML section <Indication> can describe several indications. relation uses (<Indication> sections) indications defined indicator project illustrated . example, 25 “indications” 15 uses.
code: culture_pest_combinations <- example_register$uses |>    filter(pNbr == 6521L) |>    left_join(example_register$cultures, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    left_join(example_register$pests, by = c("pNbr", "use_nr")) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, application_area_de, culture_de, pest_de)  kable(culture_pest_combinations)

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model
text: Sometimes, use specific comments can found application_comments table.
code: example_register$application_comments |>   filter(pNbr == 7105, use_nr %in% 1:2) |>    select(pNbr, use_nr, ends_with("de"), ends_with("fr")) |>    kable()

title: The Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products as a Relational Data Model

title: Statistics on products containing microorganisms in the latest XML dump of the SRPPP
text: following list used identify product categories containing microorganisms. resulting product categories containing microorganisms defined follows: corresponding products shown .
code: srppp$categories |>   group_by(category_de) |>   summarise(n = n()) |>   kable() microorganism_categories = c(   "Lebende Organismen (Bakterien)",   "Lebende Organismen (Pilze)",   "Lebende Organismen (gegen Pilze)") kable(data.frame(Category = microorganism_categories)) products_in_microorganism_categories <- srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>   filter(category_de %in% microorganism_categories) |>   select(pNbr, wNbr, name, category_de) |>   arrange(pNbr) n_in_categories <- nrow(products_in_microorganism_categories) kable(products_in_microorganism_categories)

title: Statistics on products containing microorganisms in the latest XML dump of the SRPPP
text: following lists active substances insecticides fungicides used establish filter criteria active substances microorganisms. following genus names established filtering criteria. results following list active ingredients. following products contain one active ingredients.
code: srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>   filter(category_de == "Insektizid") |>   left_join(srppp$ingredients, by = "pNbr", relationship = "many-to-many") |>   left_join(srppp$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(substance_de) |>   unique() |>   arrange(substance_de) |>   kable() srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>   filter(category_de == "Fungizid") |>   left_join(srppp$ingredients, by = "pNbr", relationship = "many-to-many") |>   left_join(srppp$substances, by = "pk") |>   select(substance_de) |>   unique() |>   arrange(substance_de) |>   kable() microorganism_genus_names <- c(   "Bacillus",   "Beauveria",   "Metarhizium",   "Xenorhabdus",   "Phlebia",   "Pseudomonas") kable(data.frame("Genus names" = microorganism_genus_names, check.names = FALSE)) microorganism_regexp <- paste(microorganism_genus_names, collapse = "|") microorganism_ingredients <- srppp$substances |>   filter(grepl(microorganism_regexp, substance_de)) |>   select(pk, substance_de) kable(microorganism_ingredients) additional_products_containing_microorganisms <- srppp$products |>   filter(!isSalePermission) |>   left_join(srppp$ingredients, by = "pNbr", relationship = "many-to-many") |>   filter(pk %in% microorganism_ingredients$pk) |>   select(-pk) |>   left_join(srppp$categories, by = "pNbr") |>    select(pNbr, wNbr, name, category_de) |>   arrange(pNbr) n_additional <- nrow(additional_products_containing_microorganisms) kable(additional_products_containing_microorganisms)

title: Statistics on products containing microorganisms in the latest XML dump of the SRPPP
text: summary, 1739 products, 21 microorganism categories shown , 48 products insecticide fungicide categories contain active substance name contains one microorganism genus names listed . consolidated list 42 unique products identified way shown . products listed twice, identified via ways.
code: products_containing_microorganisms <- rbind(   products_in_microorganism_categories,    additional_products_containing_microorganisms) |>   arrange(pNbr, category_de) |>   unique() n_unique <- length(unique(products_containing_microorganisms$pNbr)) kable(products_containing_microorganisms)

title: Read the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products
text: Functions generate data objects XML versions Swiss Register Plant Protection Products (SRPPP). online version register can accessed https://www.psm.admin.ch/de/produkte. guarantee correspondence data read using package online version, original registration documents. Also, Federal Food Safety Veterinary Office, coordinating authorisation plant protection products Switzerland, answer requests regarding package.

title: Read the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products
code: install.packages("srppp")

what: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: function searches uses given list active substances reports either table uses number available alternative products use, detailed table alternative product uses, table uses without alternatives, list containing three tables.

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
code: alternative_products(   srppp,   active_ingredients,   details = FALSE,   missing = FALSE,   list = FALSE,   lang = c("de", "fr", "it"),   resolve_cultures = TRUE )

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: srppp srppp_dm object. active_ingredients Character vector active ingredient names matched column 'substances_de' srppp table 'substances'. details table alternative uses 'wNbr' 'use_nr' returned? missing set TRUE, uses without alternative product registrations listed. list TRUE, list three tables returned, table uses without alternative products ("Lückenindikationen"), table number alternative products use, , detailed table alternative uses. argument overrides arguments 'details' 'missing'. lang language used active ingredient names returned tables. resolve_cultures Logical. Specifies whether resolve culture levels specific hierarchical level (leaf nodes) using parent-child relationship dataset derived culture tree. TRUE (default), function maps culture levels corresponding leaf nodes. enables precise identification alternative products specific culture level. resolves problem products sometimes authorised different cultural groups. means actual "Lückenindikationen" can identified. supported German, .e. lang = "de". FALSE, function retains original culture levels without hierarchical resolution. option useful original structure culture data needs preserved. Note: argument applicable language set German (de). languages, resolve_cultures functionality implemented must set FALSE.

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: tibble::tibble containing use definitions defined , .e. containing columns application area, crop pathogen. Depending arguments, columns summarizing listing alternative products /uses also contained.

title: Find alternative products for all products containing certain active substances — alternative_products
text: use defined combination application area, crop ('culture') pathogen ('pest'). means, alternative product found, exact match application area, crop pathogen.

what: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: application rate g active substance/ha calculated information dosage (product concentration application solution) application volume, directly product application rate. complicated fact rate ("expenditure" XML file) units l/ha can refer application solution liquid product.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
code: application_rate_g_per_ha(   product_uses,   aggregation = c("max", "mean", "min"),   dosage_units = c("percent_ww", "percent_vv", "state_of_matter"),   skip_l_per_ha_without_g_per_L = TRUE,   fix_l_per_ha = TRUE )

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: product_uses tibble containing columns 'pNbr', 'use_nr', 'application_area_de', 'min_dosage', 'max_dosage', 'min_rate', 'max_rate', 'uses' table srppp_dm object, well columns 'percent' 'g_per_L' 'ingredients' table srppp_dm object. aggregation represent range present, e.g. "max" (default) "mean". dosage_units units given, units "%", applied amount g/ha calculated using reference application volume dosage. dosage units explicitly given, can specify assumptions using argument (currently implemented, .e. specifying argument effect). skip_l_per_ha_without_g_per_L Per default, uses use rate units l/ha skipped, product concentration g/L. also done 2023 indicator project. fix_l_per_ha review 2023 indicator project calculations, number cases identified unit l/ha specifies water volume, product volume. TRUE (default), cases corrected, FALSE, cases discarded.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: tibble containing one additional column 'rate_g_per_ha'

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: cases (currently one), external information found, indicating "expenditure" application volume l_per_ha_is_water_volume.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
text: reference application volume used 'expenditure'. selected based product application area. correct hops ('Hopfen') culture, unique reference application volume 3000 L/ha. Applications hops excluded calculating mean use rates indicator project (Korkaric 2023), arguing grown large areas Switzerland.

title: Calculate application rates for active ingredients — application_rate_g_per_ha
code: # \donttest{ library(srppp) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dm, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  sr <- try(srppp_dm())  # Fall back to internal test data if downloading or reading fails if (inherits(sr, "try-error")) {   sr <- system.file("testdata/Daten_Pflanzenschutzmittelverzeichnis_2024-12-16.zip",       package = "srppp") |>     srppp_xml_get_from_path(from = "2024-12-16") |>     srppp_dm() }  product_uses_with_ingredients <- sr$substances |>   filter(substance_de %in% c("Halauxifen-methyl", "Kupfer (als Kalkpr\u00E4parat)")) |>   left_join(sr$ingredients, by = "pk") |>   left_join(sr$uses, by = "pNbr") |>   left_join(sr$products, by = "pNbr") |>   select(pNbr, name, use_nr,     min_dosage, max_dosage, min_rate, max_rate, units_de,     application_area_de,     substance_de, percent, g_per_L)  application_rate_g_per_ha(product_uses_with_ingredients) |>   filter(name %in% c("Cerelex", "Pixxaro EC", "Bordeaux S")) |>   select(ai = substance_de, app_area = application_area_de,     min_d = min_dosage,  max_d = max_dosage,     min_r = min_rate, max_r = max_rate,     units_de, rate = rate_g_per_ha) |>   print(n = Inf) #> # A tibble: 5 × 8 #>   ai                app_area min_d max_d min_r max_r units_de  rate #>   <chr>             <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 Halauxifen-methyl Feldbau     NA    NA  1       NA l/ha      6.25 #> 2 Halauxifen-methyl Feldbau     NA    NA  0.75    NA l/ha      4.69 #> 3 Halauxifen-methyl Feldbau     NA    NA  1       NA l/ha      6.25 #> 4 Halauxifen-methyl Feldbau     NA    NA  0.5     NA l/ha      6.25 #> 5 Halauxifen-methyl Feldbau     NA    NA  0.5     NA l/ha      6.25 # }

title: Build a Culture Tree — build_culture_tree
text: Constructs hierarchical tree structure culture description table created within srppp_dm function. culture can one two parent nodes srppp XML file, nodes two parent nodes duplicated. duplicated nodes retain primary key attribute, information identity get lost.

title: Build a Culture Tree — build_culture_tree
code: build_culture_tree(culture_descriptions)

title: Build a Culture Tree — build_culture_tree
text: culture_descriptions tibble containing culture descriptions following columns: desc_pk: Unique identifier culture node. de: Culture name German. fr: Culture name French. : Culture name Italian. en: Culture name English. prt_1_pk: Identifier first parent node (can NA parent). prt_2_pk: Identifier second parent node (can NA second parent).

title: Build a Culture Tree — build_culture_tree
text: data.tree::Node representing root culture hierarchy. node tree following attributes: name_de: German name culture (de column). name_fr: French name culture (fr column). name_it: Italian name culture (column). culture_id: unique identifier culture

title: Build a Culture Tree — build_culture_tree
text: function builds culture tree two main steps: Node Creation: first creates unique culture nodes adds lookup environment. node initialized German name culture_id. Relationship Establishment: establishes parent-child relationships nodes. node second parent culture duplicated duplicate associated second parent culture

what: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
title: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
text: Resolves culture levels dataset lowest hierarchical level (leaf nodes) using parent-child relationship dataset derived culture tree using German culture names. German culture names supported. match found, function assigns NA leaf_culture_de column. correct_culture_names set TRUE, function corrects variations naming aggregated culture groups "allg.".

title: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
code: resolve_cultures(   dataset,   srppp,   culture_column = "culture_de",   application_area_column = "application_area_de",   correct_culture_names = TRUE,   resolve_culture_allg = TRUE )

title: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
text: dataset data frame tibble containing data processed. include column represents culture information resolved. srppp srppp_dm object. object relations culture leaf cultures (lowest level hierarchical tree) used, stored attribute 'culture_leaf_df' culture tree, stored attribute object. culture_column (Optional) character string specifying column dataset contains culture information resolved. Defaults "culture_de". application_area_column (Optional). character string specifing name column dataset containing application area information. Default "application_area_de". correct_culture_names argument set TRUE, following corrections applied: culture_tree, consequently culture_leaf_df, variations naming aggregated culture groups "allg.". example, "Obstbau allg." "allg. Obstbau" exist. information leaf nodes available one terms. Therefore, information term containing leaf nodes transferred corresponding "allg. ..." term. resolve_culture_allg argument set TRUE, culture "allg." resolved lowest hierarchical level. information application area additionally used resolve culture "allg." lowest hierarchical level. example culture "allg." used application area "Obstbau", leaf cultures culture "Obstbau" used resolve culture "allg.". application area found culture tree, leaf cultures used resolve culture "allg.".

title: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
text: data frame tibble structure input dataset, additional column "leaf_culture_de" contains resolved leaf culture levels. cultures, defined register, leaf culture set NA.

title: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
text: resolve_cultures function processes input dataset follows Leaf Node Resolution: cultures specified column dataset resolved lowest hierarchical level (leaf nodes) based culture_leaf_df mapping. result expanded dataset includes additional column (leaf_culture_de) containing resolved cultures lowest level.

title: Resolve culture specifications to their lowest hierarchical level — resolve_cultures
code: # \donttest{ library(srppp) sr <- try(srppp_dm())  if (inherits(sr, "try-error")) {   sr <- system.file("testdata/Daten_Pflanzenschutzmittelverzeichnis_2024-12-16.zip",       package = "srppp") |>     srppp_xml_get_from_path(from = "2024-12-16") |>     srppp_dm() }  example_dataset_1 <- data.frame(   substance_de = c("Spirotetramat", "Spirotetramat", "Spirotetramat", "Spirotetramat"),   pNbr = c(7839, 7839, 7839, 7839),   use_nr = c(5, 7, 18, 22),   application_area_de = c("Obstbau", "Obstbau", "Obstbau", "Obstbau"),   culture_de = c("Birne", "Kirsche", "Steinobst", "Kernobst"),     pest_de = c("Birnblattsauger", "Kirschenfliege", "Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)", "Spinnmilben"))  # Same as above, but with culture name "Kirschen" instead of "Kirsche" example_dataset_2 <- data.frame(   substance_de = c("Spirotetramat", "Spirotetramat", "Spirotetramat", "Spirotetramat"),   pNbr = c(7839, 7839, 7839, 7839),   use_nr = c(5, 7, 18, 22),   application_area_de = c("Obstbau", "Obstbau", "Obstbau", "Obstbau"),   culture_de = c("Birne", "Kirschen", "Steinobst", "Kernobst"),   pest_de = c("Birnblattsauger", "Kirschenfliege", "Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)", "Spinnmilben"))  resolve_cultures(example_dataset_1, sr) #>     substance_de pNbr use_nr application_area_de culture_de #> 1  Spirotetramat 7839      5             Obstbau      Birne #> 2  Spirotetramat 7839      7             Obstbau    Kirsche #> 3  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 4  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 5  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 6  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 7  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 8  Spirotetramat 7839     22             Obstbau   Kernobst #> 9  Spirotetramat 7839     22             Obstbau   Kernobst #> 10 Spirotetramat 7839     22             Obstbau   Kernobst #>                     pest_de      leaf_culture_de #> 1           Birnblattsauger                Birne #> 2            Kirschenfliege              Kirsche #> 3  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse) Pfirsich / Nektarine #> 4  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)             Aprikose #> 5  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)              Kirsche #> 6  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)            Zwetschge #> 7  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)              Pflaume #> 8               Spinnmilben               Quitte #> 9               Spinnmilben                Apfel #> 10              Spinnmilben                Birne  # Here we get NA for the leaf culture of "Kirschen" resolve_cultures(example_dataset_2, sr) #>     substance_de pNbr use_nr application_area_de culture_de #> 1  Spirotetramat 7839      5             Obstbau      Birne #> 2  Spirotetramat 7839      7             Obstbau   Kirschen #> 3  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 4  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 5  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 6  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 7  Spirotetramat 7839     18             Obstbau  Steinobst #> 8  Spirotetramat 7839     22             Obstbau   Kernobst #> 9  Spirotetramat 7839     22             Obstbau   Kernobst #> 10 Spirotetramat 7839     22             Obstbau   Kernobst #>                     pest_de      leaf_culture_de #> 1           Birnblattsauger                Birne #> 2            Kirschenfliege                 <NA> #> 3  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse) Pfirsich / Nektarine #> 4  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)             Aprikose #> 5  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)              Kirsche #> 6  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)            Zwetschge #> 7  Blattläuse (Röhrenläuse)              Pflaume #> 8               Spinnmilben               Quitte #> 9               Spinnmilben                Apfel #> 10              Spinnmilben                Birne  # what: srppp: Read the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp-package
title: srppp: Read the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp-package
text: Generate data objects XML versions Swiss Register Plant Protection Products. online version register can accessed https://www.psm.admin.ch/de/produkte. guarantee correspondence data read using package online version, original registration documents. Also, Federal Food Safety Veterinary Office, coordinating authorisation plant protection products Switzerland, answer requests regarding package.

title: srppp: Read the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp-package
text: Maintainer: Johannes Ranke johannes.ranke@agroscope.admin.ch (ORCID) contributors: Daniel Baumgartner (Provided feedback, explanations background information) [contributor] Marcel Mathis marcel.mathis@agroscope.admin.ch [reviewer, contributor] Romualdus Kasteel romualdus.kasteel@agroscope.admin.ch (Provided feedback version 0.3.4) [reviewer] Elisabeth Lutz elisabeth.lutz@agroscope.admin.ch [contributor] Agroscope [copyright holder]

text: Information products duplicated across several products sharing P-Number associated directly P-Number, order avoid duplications. reading XML file, checked resulting deduplication remove data. cases historical XML files, two <Product> sections sharing W-Number. cases, one apparently included error informed decision taken reading data one sections discarded. details procedure can found source code function srppp_xml_get_products.

title: Create a dm object from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_dm
text: table obligations, following information mitigation measures extracted ones relevant environment (SPe 3). "sw_drift_dist": Unsprayed buffer towards surface waters mitigate spray drift meters "sw_runoff_dist": Vegetated buffer towards surface waters mitigate runoff meters "sw_runoff_points": Required runoff mitigation points mitigate runoff "biotope_drift_dist": Unsprayed buffer towards biotopes (defined articles 18a 18b Federal Act Protection Nature Cultural Heritage) mitigate spray drift meters

title: Create a dm object from an XML version of the Swiss Register of Plant Protection Products — srppp_dm
code: # Avoid NOTE on CRAN caused by checks >5s library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dm, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  sr <- try(srppp_dm())  # Fall back to internal test data if downloading or reading fails if (inherits(sr, "try-error")) {   sr <- system.file("testdata/Daten_Pflanzenschutzmittelverzeichnis_2024-12-16.zip",       package = "srppp") |>     srppp_xml_get_from_path(from = "2024-12-16") |>     srppp_dm() }  dm_examine_constraints(sr) #> ! Unsatisfied constraints: #> • Table `pNbrs`: primary key `pNbr`: has 1 missing values #> • Table `ingredients`: foreign key `pk` into table `substances`: values of `ingredients$pk` not in `substances$pk`: 50804ef0-5d85-46cc-b697-17a7bca5f8f0 (1), 738e64d8-6e48-415f-9341-50608bd3273c (1), c1966a3b-0a53-43aa-8abc-c736e118a497 (1) #> • Table `parallel_imports`: foreign key `pNbr` into table `pNbrs`: values of `parallel_imports$pNbr` not in `pNbrs$pNbr`: 7738 (5), 8332 (1), 9033 (1) dm_draw(sr) %0 Technische Schutzvorrichtungen während des Ausbringens (z.B. geschlossene Traktorkabine) können die vorgeschriebene persönliche Schutzausrüstung ersetzen, wenn gewährleistet ist, dass sie einen vergleichbaren oder höheren Schutz bieten. |  # Show application comments for use number 1 boxer_uses |>   filter(use_nr == 1) |>   left_join(sr$application_comments, join_by(pNbr, use_nr)) |>   select(use_nr, application_comment_de) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   use_nr application_comment_de                            #>    <int> <chr>                                             #> 1      1 Herbst, Frühjahr; Vorauflauf, früher Nachauflauf.  # Illustrate 'obligations' indicating varying effects sr$obligations |>   filter(varying_effect) |>   select(pNbr, use_nr, code, obligation_de) #> # A tibble: 199 × 4 #>     pNbr use_nr code  obligation_de                                              #>    <int>  <int> <chr> <chr>                                                      #>  1  4683      1 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  2  4683      2 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  3  4683      3 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  4  4685      1 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  5  4685      2 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  6  4751      1 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  7  4751      2 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  8  4751      3 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #>  9  4751      4 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #> 10  4751      5 NA    Die Wirkungseffizienz der Nützlinge kann je nach Pflanzen… #> # ℹ 189 more rows

title: version 1.2.0
text: Adapt new format XML file.

title: version 1.1.0 (CRAN release: 2025-07-07)
text: Example code vignettes: satisfy CRAN policy, fall back use register version distributed test data package (see ) case downloading reading standard URL fails, instead throwing error. makes check process CRAN robust server outage changed URL. Include information completeness effect target organism column type pests table srppp_dm object. Possible types PEST_FULL_EFFECT, PEST_PARTIAL_EFFECT PEST_SIDE_EFFECT. obligations table, include column varying_effect, contains TRUE case obligation text indicates full effect demonstrated cases. R/resolve_cultures.R: Function expand dataframe culture names lowest level (leafs) culture tree constructed srppp_dm. Add culture tree Node object data.tree package attribute srppp_dm objects show main vignette. Remove vignette intended JOSS, rejected Remove duplicate ingredient entries substance product (issue #6) inst/testdata/: Add zipped XML 16 December 2024 testing purposes test resulting srppp_dm object referential integrity srppp_dm(): Add argument verbose default TRUE.

title: version 1.0.1 (CRAN release: 2024-11-01)
text: Trim leading trailing whitespace descriptions read using internal function get_descriptions(), addressing issue Elisabeth raised srppphist Remove html documentation built pkgdown git repository, online documentation built using github workflow Address issues found package review CRAN follows: Rename package make clear purpose read data Swiss Register Plant Protection Products Wrap example code  avoid CRAN notes checks >5s. code still tested testthat tests. Document return values exported functions

title: version 1.0.0
text: Risk mitigation measures sw_drift_dist, sw_runoff_dist, sw_runoff_points biotope_drift_dist now stored integers obligations table. table cultures, primary keys two parent cultures now included. Fix use rate calculations liquid products case dosage percent given.

title: version 0.99.2
text: R/srppp-xml.R: Revise structure srppp_dm object, verifying product sections different products P-Number identical, exception permission holder. Therefore, tables describing products, including use definitions, now tied pNbrs table pNbr primary key, instead products table wNbr primary key. Functions, example code, vignettes tests adapted accordingly.

text: vignettes/srppp.rmd: Add overview vignette displayed link ‘Get started’ online documentation

title: version 0.3.3
text: Remove redundant information ingredients table removing W-Numbers containing dash. P-Numbers added ingredient table well, product compositions can easily obtained using ingredients table. Finally remove W-Numbers ingredients table. consequence, products ingredients must now joined ‘pNbr’, relationship ‘many--many’, ‘pNbr’ can occur products table. grouping products table P-Numbers removed, seemed used anywhere created spurious messages constraint checking.
